The Community of Portuguese Speaking Countries continues to be a privileged space for international affirmation, strengthening historical and cultural ties. Membership in NATO guarantees strategic security, but also implies responsibilities in contexts of geopolitical tension. Portugal, due to its Atlantic and Portuguese-speaking position, plays the role of a bridge between continents and cultures, and the presidency symbolizes this international vocation. The President is seen as the guarantor of balance and national unity, especially in times of crisis. In addition to formal powers, the presidency has a symbolic dimension, representing collective values ​​and identities. The philosophy of the Portuguese presidency is based on the idea that the President must be an arbiter and moderator, but also an inspiration and mobilizer. The 2026 election puts into debate different conceptions of the position with a more interventionist presidency, focused on moral authority, or a more discreet presidency, focused on institutional mediation. This philosophical reflection is essential to understand the meaning of the election. The polls available until January 13, 2026 continue to show an extremely competitive and fragmented Portuguese presidential race, marked by the absence of a clear favorite and the persistence of a high number of undecided voters. The most recent panorama reveals a significant recomposition in the front group in which António José Seguro and João Cotrim de Figueiredo now appear as the most dynamic candidates, while André Ventura and Henrique Gouveia e Melo register slight drops and Luís Marques Mendes drops to fifth place, with values ​​that fluctuate between around 15% and 17%, moving away from the immediate dispute for passage to the second round. António José Seguro has benefited from a continuous growth trend since the end of 2025, supported by a profile perceived as stable and institutional. João Cotrim de Figueiredo, in turn, consolidated an upward trajectory that brought him closer to the core of the main candidates, reinforcing his appeal among young, urban and liberal voters. André Ventura maintains a strong core of expressive support, but continues to face difficulties in expanding his electoral base, appearing systematically weakened in the second round scenarios. Henrique Gouveia e Melo preserves a relevant capital of public trust, although it has lost some momentum in recent weeks, reflecting a more volatile and competitive political environment. Luís Marques Mendes, who came to lead voting intentions at the end of 2025, is now facing a consistent drop that places him outside the most competitive group, illustrating the electorate's sensitivity to last-minute movements and strategic repositionings. The general picture remains marked by the coexistence of very different profiles with independent candidates with a strong public reputation, figures with long party experience and protagonists of more populist and security-based speeches. This diversity reflects an electorate divided between the search for institutional stability, the appreciation of technical competence and the desire for political renewal. Ventura's continued presence in the leading group, even with a low chance of victory in a second round, confirms the consolidation of a protest discourse that has found space in Portuguese society. In parallel, the growth of Cotrim de Figueiredo highlights the search for liberal and reformist alternatives, while the partial recovery of Seguro demonstrates the relevance of moderate profiles in a context of uncertainty. Candidates less likely to reach the second round, such as Catarina Martins, António Filipe, Jorge Pinto or Manuel João Vieira, continue to play an important role in the plurality of the debate, representing specific agendas and contributing to the democratic vitality of the process. As a whole, the trends up to January 13, 2026 reveal a country in deep reflection about the type of leadership it wants for the next decade. Between tradition and innovation, continuity and change, European integration and national affirmation, the future President will be called upon to preserve republican and democratic values, interpret the expectations of a changing society and offer a vision capable of uniting different sensibilities in an increasingly demanding global context. These polls place André Ventura in an approximate range of between 19.5% and 20% of voting intentions in the first round of the presidential elections. From these values, it is possible to project the number of votes that could be achieved in different electoral participation scenarios. If voter turnout is similar to that of the last presidential elections, with around 4.2 million voters, Ventura should receive between approximately 820,000 and 840,000 votes, remaining below the symbolic threshold of one million votes in this scenario of lower participation. If participation is close to that recorded in the 2024 legislative elections, around 6.5 million voters, the same percentage range would translate into a total of between approximately 1.26 million and 1.30 million votes, a value still lower than the level reached by the AD in the legislative elections. In the second round scenarios, polls place Ventura in a range between 25% and 29%. Applying these values ​​to a participation similar to that of the presidential elections, the candidate could obtain between approximately 1.05 million and 1.22 million votes. If the turnout is comparable to that of the legislative elections, the projected range rises to values ​​between approximately 1.62 million and 1.88 million votes. Such an expressive vote for a candidate with this profile is often understood as a reflection of social tensions accumulated over time. It reveals a feeling of dissatisfaction with the functioning of institutions, the perception of persistent inequalities and the idea that issues such as security, justice, cost of living, immigration or the quality of public services have not received effective responses. At the same time, the growth of more direct and confrontational speeches shows that a significant part of the electorate is looking for simple language, firm positions and an attitude of defiance towards the traditional political system, even if this accentuates divisions. This phenomenon also highlights the fragmentation of the party system, with less loyalty to traditional parties and greater openness to alternatives that break with the usual pattern. This dynamic changes balances, strategies and even the way campaigns are conducted. However, even with a high vote, there remain clear limits to the ability to transform notoriety into a majority, which indicates resistance in other sectors of society and contributes to a more polarized political environment, but not necessarily dominated by a single bloc. For the political system, a result of this type acts as a warning. It shows that there are groups that feel excluded, policies that are not meeting expectations and perceptions of injustice or insecurity that remain without a convincing answer. This signal forces traditional parties to rethink priorities, adjust the way they communicate and reinforce proximity to different segments of the population. Finally, this movement is part of a broader trend observed in several European countries, where candidates with similar speeches have gained ground. Many analysts interpret this phenomenon as a consequence of cultural, economic and technological transformations that are profoundly altering people's relationship with politics and democratic institutions.

item.title: Mia Soave!…
item.description: There are poems that we need completely. Anyone who does not know how to remember one in special times and adapt it to their situation suffers from a resource that cannot be replaced by any other skill. Without a learned poem, we are stripped of humanity in the face of the fierce blows of fate, our neuronal composition has no connections and everything becomes imprecisely misaligned. We are in the throes watching the death of those we saw being born, our immense pain does not need psychologists, priests, mentors, gurus, we just need something that comes towards us and that we can thank the heavens for having known about it. The poem. In the agonizing dawn a poem is released like a well-said bird in farewell:« – Mia Suave..- Ave?! … Almeia?!… Blue Mariposa… Trance!… » and so we said goodbye on the border between death and life where the sound of the poem resonated in the telepathic night «It doesn’t hurt for you My Chest…/ Mia Soave…- Ave! – Almeia!…» And the lustral soul, still wounded, was able to spell out songs from the old angels, and soften passages, bypass the asphalt of the serious lack of a beloved being. It is a poem by Ângelo de Lima who dedicated it to his friends at Orpheu, introducing such eloquence that only in sacred situations do we remember it, but it is the things that remind us and intersect with the right effect of purposes, and great is the poet who blesses and guides us in such final moments. We might say: what poem is this? It's a poem. It seems like a concrete poem made up of random meanings that aim to break the monotony of sentences made from feeling, its sequential metric, its canonical purpose, and therefore being distant and forgotten from the terreiro of things given in this matter, which on the other hand is the most beautiful poem in the Portuguese language of the twentieth century without appeal or annotation in the stagnation of descriptions of all kinds that do not reach balm in vital moments. It is with a mix of surprise and delight that something like this happens to us, it is an initiation. Ângelo de Lima was savagely murdered in the corridors of psychoanalysis and psychiatric opinions at the time, his work didn't even gain traction in literary currents, but when he visits us, everything changes. «– From Sunset to Epic… Dorto… Stringe… O Corpo Elance… Go to the Grave… – Il C´or rest…- Mia Soave… – Ave!… – Almeia!…» This poem is full of light and tears, only those who know it are visited by it at the serious time of a farewell. He sings more than he spells, he is more a poem than a written thing, he caresses, ennobles and elevates, and when everything is clouded by broken love he still gives us the balm of the great mysteries. Mia Soave, my Love « – It Doesn't Hurt For You My Chest…/ I Don't Cry in the Praying Cycle…/ In Profane…- Edd'ora…Elect!…» The dawn was advancing, the moon was high, and a poem visited the farewell curve like a song of love and death, but surprisingly in a future hope that doesn't yet know where it will be born again. A mantra like this can lead us to think that the breath that comes from there saves our soul forever, giving the one that leaves a hitherto unknown dimension, and to those that remain the certainty that only great, great poetry saves beings and distinguishes them. And this is a great poem. Transfiguring, miraculous, beautiful. What comes to say sequentially is a challenge. That nothing says anything if the word doesn't have the dimension it brings us here.

item.title: Two more shows with Japanese artists canceled
item.description: The shows by the boy band Nexz, made up of Japanese and Korean artists, were canceled on Friday, without any official explanation, according to a statement from concessionaire Sands China. The two concerts were scheduled for Saturday and Sunday and were sold out. Initially, the band managed by JYP, one of the main Korean entertainment companies, had only planned one concert in Macau. However, the great demand, as early as December, led to a second show being scheduled the following day. On Friday, one day before the first concert, the cancellation occurred. “We inform you that the concert “NEXZ SPECIAL CONCERT in MACAO”, originally scheduled for the 17th and 18th of January 2026, has been cancelled”, announced the concessionaire, via social media. “We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your understanding and continued support,” it added. Shows with the participation of Japanese artists in Macau began to be canceled, after a worsening of diplomatic tensions between Japan and China related to Taiwan. Cancel culture The wave of cancellation of shows with Japanese artists in China began in the interior. However, the trend extended to Macau. The first target in Macao was pop singer Ayumi Hamasaki, whose concert, scheduled for January 10th, was canceled on December 9th. Days earlier, on November 29, Hamasaki's concert in Shanghai had also been cancelled. The cancellations didn't stop there, and at the beginning of the year it was time for Japanese singer Mika Nakashima's concert to be cancelled. At the time, the existence of “unavoidable circumstances” was presented as justification. The cancellation of shows is not new. In January 2024, pressure from the IC led to the cancellation of the “Made by Beauty” show due to the participation of drag queens. However, IC president Deland Leong denied any involvement in the spate of recent cancellations.

item.title: CCM | Play “Goodbye, My Concubine” with workshops and activities
item.description: Between January 29th and February 1st, the Beijing People's Theater company presents four sessions of the play “Adeus, Minha Concubina” at Studio II of the Macau Cultural Center (CCM). Tickets cost 220 patacas and are on sale at the Enjoy Macao Ticket Office. Spectators can enjoy a 50 percent discount, “upon presentation of a valid Macau Resident Identity Card, Full-time Student Card, Macau Teacher Card, Special Benefits Card for the Elderly or Disability Assessment Registration Card”, said the Cultural Affairs Bureau on Friday. The performance of the play presented by the Beijing People's Theater is one of the highlights of the “1st Season of Chinese Culture Shows”, which began at the end of November last year and runs until March. The cycle is organized by the IC and the Publicity, Culture and Sports Department of the Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Macao SAR, with the sponsorship of the Secretariat for Social Affairs and Culture. The play, described by the organization as immersive, was written by Mo Yan, winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature. The IC adds that the production of “Goodbye, My Concubine” that will take the CCM stage “breaks with the traditional narrative structure of historical drama, exploring timeless themes such as power, survival and responsibility through multiple encounters and a structure of temporally intertwined dialogues between the characters Yu Ji and Lü Zhi”. With an immersive scenic design, the audience will be surrounded by the Chu Army camp, sitting on cushions or straw benches arranged on various levels, to witness up close the intense plots of love and hate between the characters. Learning with art In addition to the four theater sessions, “workshops and complementary activities will also be organized that invite the public to participate and experience the beauty of traditional Chinese culture from multiple perspectives”, is described by IC. On the 30th and 31st of January, after the show (between 10pm and 10:30pm), spectators will have the opportunity to talk to the artists. On January 27th, in anticipation, the “Inter-regional Dialogue between Young Artists” will be organized, which will feature “the main creators of the production and young actors from Mainland China and Macau”. The objective of this activity is to launch an “in-depth discussion about the construction of characters and the performing arts, deconstructing the creative process, perceptions and techniques for representing dramatic characters from multiple dimensions, such as action, personality and image”. The talk, scheduled for the Auditorium of the Macau Art Museum, is aimed at theater groups and young actors based in Macau and admission will be on a first-come, first-served basis. In addition to the conversations, an enamel jewelry workshop will be held on January 31st between 4:30 pm and 5:30 pm in the Conference Room of the Macau Cultural Center, aimed at Macau residents over 6 years old The next day, in the same place and at the same time, the Calligraphy Workshop for the Elderly will be held for Macau residents over 55 years of age. Places are limited and interested parties can register on the Macau Single Account application.

item.title: FAM | IC welcomes proposals for new edition of the festival
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) is welcoming proposals for shows and initiatives that can be integrated into the 36th edition of the Macau Arts Festival (FAM), which takes place between May and June this year. According to a statement, the idea is to provide opportunities for artistic personalities and local organizations. “Over the years, FAM has sought to encourage the development of local arts and provide a quality platform for the presentation and exchange of performing arts in Macau”, describes the IC in a note. The aim of FAM is to “expand the exhibition platform for local performing arts and incorporate more creative works with local characteristics”. For this year's edition, the theme is “Cultural Encounter on the Maritime Silk Road”, inviting participants to “be inspired by Macau's unique cultural heritage”, to present works centered on the territory or “that incorporate specific elements of the city, such as historical architecture, notable figures, places and folk tales, exploring the city's distinct charm”. Proposals in the competition must fall into two categories, namely “Individual Programs”, which incorporate “all genres of shows, such as theater, Cantonese opera, dance, children's shows and multimedia performing arts”. In this category, the IC encourages “innovation and creative advances in artistic creation”. In turn, the second category, “Outdoor Showcase” consists of a “popular community program that seeks outdoor performances for the whole family and in a variety of formats”. The programs selected by IC will receive financial support to cover production costs. Interested local associations and individuals must register by February 10th. Candidates approved in the first selection phase must attend an interview with the jury that same month.

item.title: CCM | Musical “Operação Oops!” presented at the end of the month
item.description:
Between January 31st and February 2nd, the small auditorium of the Macau Cultural Center hosts the musical “Operação Oops!”, based on the novel of the same name by playwright Lawrence Lei I Leong, born in Macau. The cast stars Jordan Cheng, who won the “Best Actor” award at the 31st edition of the Hong Kong Theater Awards
At the end of the month, Macau hosts a new show that takes place in the small auditorium of the Macau Cultural Center (CCM) and which is the result of a commission from the Cultural Institute (IC) within the context of the “Commissioning of Performing Arts Productions 2024-2026” program. This is the musical “Operação Oops!”, which takes the stage between January 31st and February 2nd. According to a note from the IC, it is an adaptation of the novel of the same name by local playwright Lawrence Lei I Leong, and features several theater figures who have already won awards and have proven themselves in the world of entertainment. The music for the show, for example, was composed by Leon Ko, who already won a Golden Horse at the Taiwanese film awards in 2005, for the soundtrack to the film “Perhaps Love”. Furthermore, the public will be able to see up close the acting work of Jordan Cheng, protagonist of the “dynamic cast”, born in Macau and who was honored as “Best Actor” at the 31st Hong Kong Theater Awards. In turn, the show will be directed by Fong Chun Kit, one of the creative minds at the Hong Kong Repertory Theatre, while the choreography is designed by local dance creator Florence Cheong.
“Moving up in life” “Operation Oops!” tells the story of a group of people who cannot find their way in life or have stability, and who, “disappointed with the exorbitant rent prices, decide to kidnap a real estate developer”, describes the show’s synopsis. However, not everything goes as planned, and “frustrated by the occurrence of a series of unfortunate mishaps, the group sees their no-budget kidnapping plan enter a chaotic spiral”. Thus, “between constant arguments and jokes”, the public is led to understand how all this confusion will end. “Illustrating a deliciously absurd story to the sound of captivating melodies, in a constant satirical and humorous tone, ‘Operação Oops!’ engages the audience in a surprisingly deep way”, like “discovering wisdom in a fun fortune cookie”, the synopsis also reads. Alongside the presentations of the show, the IC “will invite representatives from various theater production entities, companies and art festivals from Mainland China and neighboring regions to travel to Macau in order to promote exchanges and hold a ‘Local Program Presentation Session'”, it is described in a statement. The aim is to “create a platform to promote original works from Macau’s performing arts sector and explore opportunities for collaboration”. This session will take place on February 1st, at 3:15 pm, at Studio I of the CCM and will take place in Mandarin without translation, and is open to associations or companies linked to the performing arts, legally registered in Macau, or to individuals aged 18 or over who are residents of the territory. Registration opens today and runs until January 27th.

item.title: New association wants to contribute to the study of law in Macau
item.description: The Association of Legal Studies of Macau and Portugal was created to give life to a mega undertaking, the publication of the annotated Macau Civil Procedure Code, and, later, of works “outside the most popular topics”. David Sá Machado, a Portuguese lawyer working in Macau, is the ideologue of what will be the first annotated version, published in full, of the Civil Procedure Code of the semi-autonomous Chinese region. The three volumes, with the contribution of around 60 authors, including “lawyers, magistrates, academic professors, advisors and other jurists from Portugal and Macau”, should see the light of day later this year, the person responsible explains to Lusa, noting that they are in the review phase. “If there are changes to the code planned, we may delay a little”, he adds. To facilitate the publication of the work, “an added value” that aims to be a “contribution to law in Macau”, the Association of Legal Studies of Macau and Portugal was created. “Other projects will emerge later”, says Lusa Sá Machado, president of the association, indicating the intention of, in the future, organizing “more pedagogical and more didactic initiatives”. Still talking about this project of around three thousand pages and coordinated by two women – Maria José Capelo, associate professor at the Faculty of Law at the University of Coimbra, and Teresa Leong, retired judge from Macau – the lawyer notes that it will be produced in Portuguese, although a Chinese version is also planned, as “the target audience is jurists from Macau”. “An annotated code should serve to clarify the reader of the various interpretative meanings of the norms and, perhaps, add something from the point of view of the right to be constituted”, he indicates. “I think it always enriches any legal system”, he adds Existing versions Macau has annotated versions of the Civil Code, the Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure, and between 2006 and 2008, the first two volumes of the annotated and commented Code of Civil Procedure were published, authored by Cândida da Silva Antunes Pires and Viriato de Lima. The work, however, remained unfinished, recalls the lawyer. Sá Machado, also one of the authors, defends the importance of the project: "We are always using Portuguese codes, Portuguese notes. We are left with something of our own." Still talking about the work, which will be published in Portugal by Edições Almedina – after making “some approaches in Macau, informally” -, the lawyer says that “I would like it to be a reference work”.

item.title: Birth rate | Equality and balance between essential work and life
item.description: A UPM academic believes that Macau should legislate equal parental leave, promoting gender equality and balance between personal life and work, which she claims are essential factors in reversing the drop in birth rates. “The balance between professional and personal life is a key factor in boosting the fertility rate,” Lok Cheng, an academic at the Macau Polytechnic University (UPM) who studies public policy, told Lusa. Lok's research, which compares Macau's parenting policies with those of countries such as Germany, Sweden and the United States, supports this conclusion. Macau recorded the lowest birth rate in the world in 2024 and the lowest number of births in almost 50 years in 2025, said, at the beginning of the year, the deputy director of the Macau public hospital, Tai Wa Hou, quoted by the Chinese language channel of the public broadcaster TDM Macau. This decline has persisted despite a revised budget approved last year to strengthen social supports, including subsidies for parents with children up to three years old, increases in birth benefits and marriage subsidies. Macau currently offers 70 days of maternity leave and only five days of paternity leave for workers in the private sector (in the public sector it is 90 days for mothers and five for fathers), recalled the expert: “Less than the 98 days recommended by the International Labor Organization”, she said. This disparity, argued Lok, reinforces the idea that women have the main responsibility for newborns, which also has an impact on their professional career. “We have tacitly accepted that women have a greater responsibility for caring for newborns, and this is reflected in the workplace,” he continued. Look out In contrast, the expert, who is also a civil servant, points to European policies. “Sweden has a well-established parental policy and saw an increase in the birth rate in the early 2000s,” he said. “Both Germany and Sweden provide longer maternity leaves and are actively promoting father participation”, he reinforced. Lok explained that Sweden offers more than 300 days of shared parental leave, with 90 days reserved exclusively for the father. “Macau currently has no relevant regulations regarding fathers”, noted the academic, suggesting that the region could learn from this model to implement equal parental leave and “promote gender equality in the workplace”. Such a policy, he said, would help families share childcare and “eliminate gender bias that places women as the main caregivers”. “This prejudice is harmful to women’s professional development”, he assessed. According to the latest official data from the Macau Women's Database, the average monthly salary of the female population in 2024 was 16,800 patacas, lower than the 19,300 patacas earned by men. Lok explained that many women are hesitant to have children, fearing increased family duties and career stagnation. But when childcare is shared, “this can increase the desire to have children and reduce the associated costs”. Such a change would also benefit women professionally, he added. If parental duties were distributed more equally, “companies would be less concerned about gender when hiring women of childbearing age, and women would be able to pursue careers on an equal footing.” Lok acknowledged that it may be a challenge for Macau to adopt a system like Sweden's, but it is necessary to “move forward gradually”. “The first step is to increase maternity leave to 98 days, in accordance with international standards”, he concluded.

item.title: One Oasis | Request for postponement of entry into force of new law
item.description: The One Oasis housing complex condominium will contact the administration to try to postpone the entry into force of the new law that prohibits hiring services from tourism agencies to transport residents of the building. The decision was taken on Friday, after a condominium meeting attended by more than 120 people, including representatives of public transport companies, and the solution aims to buy time to implement other measures. The controversy over the buildings' shuttle services arose after the Government proposed a law, unanimously approved by the Legislative Assembly last year, which clarified the type of services that can be provided by tourism agencies. As a consequence, the Executive promised a campaign against these agencies when they provide the shuttle bus service to residential buildings. In a statement, the Tourism Services Directorate also indicated that the law does not change anything, and that the ban already existed. The law change caught many residents off guard. Thursday's One Oasis condominium meeting aimed to seek a solution to the problem. The path thus involves hiring one of the only two companies that can now provide the service. Transmac charges 420 patacas for each bus trip, with a vehicle with 22 seats and 38 standing seats, an average of 7.1 patacas per person. TCM did not present a budget in time for the meeting. However, the condominium considered that it needs more time to apply the new model, and is seeking to obtain a postponement of the entry into force of the new law from the Government.

item.title: Macau Legend | Cape Verdean government takes possession of hotel-casino
item.description: The Cape Verdean government announced on Friday that it took possession of the assets and building of the hotel-casino that operator Macau Legend, which is facing financial difficulties, began building in the capital, Praia, but abandoned years ago. The inauguration took place on Friday, concluding the reversal process relating to the project which was based on a memorandum of understanding signed with the State, in 2014, for “tourism-real estate investment, in the Cidade da Praia Bay, including the Ilhéu de Santa Maria and Gamboa beach”, informed the Government. In a statement, the executive reiterated that he “did everything to ensure the implementation of the project”, but the contracts “were irremediably breached” by the investors. In 2015, Macanese businessman David Chow announced an investment of 250 million euros. After reviews, the completion of the first phase of the project was scheduled for 2021. At the end of 2023, the president of Macau Legend, Li Chu Kwan, said that the group intended to close the projects in Cape Verde and Cambodia. Currently, there are only guards at the gates of the enclosure, an area of ​​around 160,000 square meters, which includes the islet, partially gutted, and an asphalt bridge a few meters long that connects it to a building of around eight floors, empty and fenced with walls – which, in the meantime, have begun to be removed.

item.title: Game | VIP revenues rose 24.1% throughout 2025
item.description: Revenues from high rollers, a segment known in Macau as VIP gaming, rose 24.1 percent in 2025, according to official data released on Friday. The VIP baccarat game reached revenues of MOP68 billion last year, revealed the Gaming Inspection and Coordination Department (DICJ). In the last quarter alone, revenue from big bets increased by 45 percent compared to the period between October and December 2024, to 20.3 billion patacas. However, VIP gaming in Macau remains far from the historic peaks reached before the Covid-19 pandemic. In 2019, baccarat for this segment represented 46.2 percent of total casino revenues. But in 2025 it was left with a share of 27.5 percent. Big bets were affected by the arrest of the leader of the largest VIP bet collecting company in the world, in November 2021. The former executive director of Suncity Alvin Chau Cheok Wa was sentenced, in January 2023, to 18 years in prison, in a case that saw the number of gambling promoter licenses issued in Macau drop from 85 to 18. According to data from DICJ, the number of licenses has been recovering and reached the mark of 30 at the end of July, a number that was maintained in the most recent update, on December 15th. Even so, it remains below the maximum limit set by the Government, which is 50. Number to increase Revenues from the most popular game in Macau, baccarat in the so-called mass market, also increased by 3.4 percent in 2025, to 137.9 billion patacas. Mass baccarat represented 57.7 percent of total casino revenue in the territory last year, being by far the most popular game of chance among Chinese gamblers. Gaming machine revenue increased by 7.3 percent compared to 2024, to MOP13.9 billion. In 2025, Macau's casinos recorded total revenue of 247.4 billion patacas, an increase of 9.1 percent. The Macau Government had forecast, in the initial budget for 2025, gaming revenue of 240 billion patacas, which would represent an increase of 6 percent compared to the previous year. However, on June 11, the Legislative Assembly approved a new budget, proposed by the Executive, which reduced the forecast for public revenue by 4.56 billion patacas. The Secretary for Economy and Finance, Anton Tai Kin Ip, admitted to deputies that the cut was due to the fact that the game's gross revenues in the first quarter of 2025 were “slightly below expectations”.

item.title: Administration | Office works in the second quarter
item.description:
The public tender proposals for the work on the superstructure of an office building for the administration in ZAPE were opened yesterday. 28 applications were received and work should begin in the second quarter of this year, after works on foundations and basements, which should end in March
Another step was taken yesterday towards the construction of the office building for the Public Administration on lot Q-1 in ZAPE, with the opening of proposals submitted to the public tender for the construction of the superstructure. The Public Works Services Directorate revealed that 28 proposals were presented and that works should begin in the second quarter of this year, after the foundation and basement work has been completed. Of the 28 proposals presented, only one was excluded. The proposed prices vary between around 309 million patacas and around 351 million patacas, while deadlines range between 618 and 625 working days. The authorities said that the construction of foundations and basements is progressing as planned and should be completed in March. The building will be built on a plot of land on the corner of Avenida Dr. Rodrigo Rodrigues and Rua do Terminal Marítimo, close to the Hotel Jai Alai, and is part of a set of five projects designed to add an area of ​​more than 130 thousand square meters to the Macao SAR's public services. The idea is to reduce public expenditure on rentals.
Final product The building will be located on a plot of land with an area of ​​around 2,770 square meters, will be 12 floors high and have three basement floors and the maximum execution time for the superstructure is 650 working days. The previous works, of basement foundations, were awarded to Companhia de Fomento Predial Sam Yau for around 79.3 million patacas, while the design work was carried out by Luís Sá Machado, Conceição Perry and Isabel Bragança Arquitectos, for 10 million patacas. Quality control was awarded to the Macau Civil Engineering Laboratory for 1.1 million patacas, while inspection was carried out by Fernando Cardoso Botelho -Fcb – Engineering Office for 5.8 million patacas. The Macau Civil Engineering Laboratory was once again the entity chosen to monitor peripheral structures, for more than 1.7 million patacas. Finally, the assessment and verification of the project within the scope of electromechanical engineering was handed over to the Institute for Development and Quality, Macau for 1.1 million patacas. In total, the construction phase of foundations and basements cost 99 million patacas.

item.title: SMG | Warning for cold weather next week and typhoon in the Philippines
item.description: The Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) warned yesterday that next week Macau will once again be under the influence of a winter monsoon, starting from Wednesday, which will cool the territory with minimum temperatures dropping to at least 12º Celsius. The same phenomenon will result in sunny days, making the days hot, and the nights cold, with thermal differences being “quite significant”. Authorities also indicated that an area of ​​low pressure, located east of the Philippines, has evolved into a tropical storm, “with the potential to become the first tropical storm of this year”. The storm, named “Nokaen”, has “quite low” chances of entering the South China Sea and affecting Macau. The SMG report that, although January is a winter month in the Northern Hemisphere, sea surface temperatures in the northwest Pacific Ocean remain relatively high (equal to or greater than 28ºC). According to the SMG, since records began in 1968, the earliest month in which tropical cyclone signals were issued in Macau was April.

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, a villager, represents half the world that recriminates the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters our house, covers his wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on the rapes in Ukraine, in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say to him: hi there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: you still haven't said what name you want to give the children! A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 At a lunch with several guests, I heard a friend, who declared herself a spiritualist, explaining the particularities of her belief, in a calm and balanced way, I would even say, without a hint of “irrationalism”. He spoke at length and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytism. “Here is someone whose belief has brought thoughtfulness!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at a certain moment a sentence comes out that horrifies me. It says, “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, and I glimpse the voracious maws of holism. Because holism has a pathological aspect, like all good things, a shadow side. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa, it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism introduced Compassion and Christianity introduced Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a Platonic stage, where we are nothing more than the shadows of something — an inextricable law -, in a determinism that calcifies all singularities, but that strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity was anchored in the conquest of chance and randomness, removing the incidences of a life from this fierce determinism that enclosed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at that moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and its volition were able to emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “there is no such thing as chance, nothing happens by chance!”, which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is usually used to seek a reason for things outside of us, in others. It's an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough to want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this mistake. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic awareness has brought a positive impact to greater ecological awareness, but followed with scholastic rigor, it stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than uncomfortable: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that each moment asks of us — but how many will make the distinction, under a Law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will abandon themselves to what is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic awareness, as the Greeks knew, but it also brings agency and the courage of decision. And we cannot give up on this. Furthermore, as Drummond shows in the poem “Quadrilha”, by Carlos Drummond de Andrade: «João loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who didn't love anyone./ João went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of a disaster, Maria stayed with her aunt,/ Joaquim committed suicide and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story.» Real always runs outside the track, completely outside our concepts. That's what matters to us — a J. Pinto Fernandes emerges at the exact moment when we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: From Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 When reading many people's reactions when this year's Nobel Prize for Literature was announced, I couldn't help but remember this comment from Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: «An editor of a large national daily newspaper wrote five lines of indignation at the fact that the Nobel Prize for Literature had been awarded to Thomas Traströmer, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did it not occur to this literary columnist, patented and paid to do his job, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of professional misconduct? Tranströmer had been translated into many languages, it was available in French.» There is always the chorus of those who wait for the Prize to be announced to complain about not having been invited to be on the jury, there is a subgroup of angry people who profess “I have never read it and I won’t even bother to read it”; It is a less than humble fauna, the one that inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners – I didn't know about the existence of Louise Glück, who I think is a great poet, or Olga Tokarczuk, for example – but this only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows everyone else and the joy of recognizing that the yardstick of the world is not measured with my short measure and that, on the contrary, it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown and learn from it. And perhaps the most stupid reaction was that of the intelligent man who wrote, But are there still people who read French?; simply confirming that today there is a new type of ignorance that is being raised with abandon: that of those who only read English. I would also prefer that, in French, Pascal Quignard, Linda Lê or even Sollers were awarded, or, among the new ones, Mathias Énard, but that does not detract from the dignity of Annie Ernaux's work (and it would have been enough to have written “Les Années”). There are books of hers that I like less, like the vulgar “Uma Paixão Simples”, but that happens with almost all authors, they have pivotal books and others that are like breaks in their itinerary. I recommend reading a beautiful book of interviews with her, “L’écriture comme un couteau”. 11/10/22 Yesterday an article appeared in the morning newspaper “Notícias”, in Maputo, reporting that the Pen Club Narrative Prize had been awarded to my wife, Teresa Noronha, for her soap opera “Tornado”, which had already won the Maria Velho da Costa Prize. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, as it is pathetic, but what is important to highlight is the note of disqualification regarding its “Mozambicanness” when they call it Luso-Mozambican. It's not that it's inaccurate, but, for those who know the context, it's a touch naughty. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, Álvaro Taruma Ronga-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican for writers from the north, etc., etc. Which doesn't appear to happen. At one point, in the novel, she writes: «Our color was never the dominant one. In colonial times we were not white, we were dressed in monhés, mugs of washed asses, the pejorative term to speak of a son of Goan and Portuguese. In the post-colonial period, I was not black and if, in Lisbon, they took me for Brazilian or Cape Verdean, in France they were lost in thought about where I was from and were surprised when they discovered that I was African. There I had to explain the wanderings of my DNA before settling in Mozambique. It took me a long time to accept that it was like that because yes, and that it was no curse that that was the case; on the contrary, I could even discover intense patterns of fantasy and freedom in this harlequin cloak that is our genealogy…” In modern-day Mozambique, it means being white… and that immediately takes precedence over what you do or what you are. It's sad, but as Naipaul warned, in these parts race is everything and people live as deeply immersed in it as, in other places, in religion. 12/10/22 Bruno Latour, an anthropologist who studied the sciences and their procedures and legitimations, law, technique and religions and who entertained himself by turning his back on the dogmas of the “moderns”, has died. For him, the place, the role of the specialist, was defined more by the perplexity he embodied than by the supposed truth that would sustain him. He proposed, as an alternative to the goodness of multiculturalism and its equivocal cliché “all different, all equal”, a return to “diplomacy”, given that this, precisely, does not start from the assumption that “we are unified because we share the same nature” but simply highlights that we “still do not share a common world”; It is necessary that we deal head-on with the “abyss of disagreement” that separates us, instead of trying to deceive it. And about politics he said, boldly: «If transparency is demanded from politicians, we kill them; if anyone demands fidelity to what the other was or what he says, kill him; If a mimetic relationship is required between what the crowd wants and what its representative says, representation is killed. These must therefore, by definition, betray, deceive, modify, distort the word. Without this ability to bend the word and betray, political language would not exist. I put forward the perfectly plausible hypothesis that political vocabulary will become as inaccessible as the religious language of the last twenty, three or fifty years.» (in “Un Monde Pluriel mais Commun”). I believe we will be needed to decipher this frantically complex world that has fallen to us.

item.title: Fuxi
item.description: O my friends, companions of these disastrous journeys through countries as old as the stars and the Moon, and as strange as the deepest interior of our wretched souls, what surprises still await us, what secret magics will we still have to overcome, what horrors will arise before our pupils dilated with astonishment and terror? Increasingly closer to our precarious existences, howls the monster of war, which threatens to merge humanity once and for all with the earth, incessantly traversed by the squalid specter of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pestilences. Oh damned human, who believes you are superior to Nature itself, but then you reveal yourself, time and time again, incapable of simply ordering your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by fickle anger and are a slave to your own ambition! You are not satisfied with white jade or resplendent gold, there is no treasure that quenches your inextinguishable thirst for command over other men, animals and things; for eternal anguish dwells in you; in you the expelled serpents crawl; for you grows, powerful and impressive, the most fertile ivy of Evil! This is perhaps why on the Mount they call the White Deer, where one of the eight immortals on a sacred mount soared through the heavens towards Penglai, lives the fuxi, a bird whose shape resembles that of a rooster, although topped by a human head. What strange copulations, what monstrous embraces, what terrible procedures must have occurred to make the existence of this sinister animal possible? We don't know, but all it takes is for our exhausted mind to dare to come up with an answer, and then we feel our skin covered in horrendous goosebumps and our heart races in parade, like a wild horse whipped by the night whip of fear, unresponsive to reins and containment. Let men refrain from visiting Monte do Veado, because despite the fact that there are riches capable of calming the wildest ambitions, if they have the unfortunate luck of catching a glimpse of a fuxi, it is certain that a war will soon break out and the cultivated fields will perish, because of it the tame animals will be beheaded, because of it the best young men of two generations will be sacrificed and the pride of the countries will be destroyed. The fuxi makes a sound reminiscent of its name. If you hear it, dark night or clear day, be on your way, because the path you are on is the surest path to misfortune!

item.title: Procrastinators Club
item.description: While rereading Easter, because of an article I'm preparing, I come across this excerpt, taken from “The Universal Man”: «Each man, morally, is one and absolute; but he has to live with attenuating his personality. (…) Coexistence is only possible between people reduced to a negative or hollow presence, which constantly gives way. Hence, the emptiness of society, an immense ghost made up of countless dead people. A superior man is antisocial or criminal. His destiny is prison and the desert”. I hesitate to think whether Pascoaes reflects here on the political-social conditions that muzzle, and, worse, in a sad country like Portugal in the middle of the Estado Novo (and the book is from 1931) where any possibilities of spontaneity and frankness in human relationships were restricted, or if it merely lends to the behavior of (oppressed) men a metaphysical framework, an “essence”, declared in the presumption of each being, in isolation, “one and absolute”. Sometimes, in addition to an excess of Spirituality (or Saudade), Pascoaes lacks the world. He is a great poet, but he is a poet who takes Ampoules-of-Great-Ideas and who therefore writes often trapped by a programmatic furor, ceasing to have pores; It is not uncommon for a glass to be erected between him and reality, the same glass that made him write in O Bailado, from 1921: «Everything is a ghost. There are only clouds, clouds of voices, clouds of souls, of afflictions and tragedies! Clouds and more clouds, appearances and more appearances! And a divine lightning that pierces them, the instantaneous Apparition that appears and throws us to the ground, dazzled!» Sometimes I felt like reminding him, as António Sérgio did, in the article “Regeneration and Tradition, Moral and Economy”, which he dedicated to Pascoaes: «Pascoais, Pascoais my dear friend: you are a pure, excellent and noble poet, but also a victim of this social environment, like us all: of this horrible isolation that you praise and I curse». «As a child, he stole two blackbirds», says Jacinto do Prado Coelho, he stole them from a nest, and he felt remorse for that all his life. The Person, few more mischiefs are known to him. Only in Álvaro de Campos does a hint of wickedness and obscenity emerge: «Ah, and the ordinary and dirty people, who always look the same,/ Who use swear words as usual words,/ Whose sons steal from grocery store doors/ And whose daughters at the age of eight – and I think this is beautiful and I love it! –/ Decent-looking men masturbate in stairwells.” (Triumphal ode). Both poets, driven by a certain idea of ​​sanctity, had the same inability to break the siege of their skin with the overflow of someone else's dam, the same curse of sublimating the concrete ferocity of eros with the gentleness of the verses. Obviously, they are both “bigger than life”, but sometimes it makes me unnerved to watch, from my position as a hatter at the Procrastinators Club, the tantrums between them, just to see who occupies, in the internal organization, the position of President and Treasurer. Although Pessoa guessed more things, for example, what he wrote in the lesser-known Ode Martial and which is reflected in the situation we live in today, in a different way, with his heart in his hands: «MARTIAL ODE (…) Helahoho! helahoho! The poor widow's sewing machine who was bayoneted... She sewed indefinitely in the afternoon… The table where the old people played, Everything mixed, everything mixed with bodies, with blood, All one river, one wave, one dragging horror. Helahoho! helahoho! I unearthed the child's tin train pressed into the middle of the [road, And I cried like all the mothers in the world about the horror of life. My pantheistic feet tripped over the sewing machine [widow who was killed with a bayonet And that poor instrument of peace stuck a spear in my heart. Yes, I was the one to blame for everything, I was the soldier for them all Who killed, raped, burned and broke, It was me and my shame and my remorse like a shadow [disforme They travel around the world like Ashavero, But behind my steps there are footsteps the size of infinity And a physical fear of being accountable to God makes me close my eyes. [eyes suddenly. (…) I ordered, captain, to shoot the trembling peasants, I let the daughters of all fathers tied to trees be raped, Now I saw that it was inside my heart that all this happened, And everything scalds and suffocates and I can't move without it [everything be the same. God have mercy on me, I didn't have it from anyone! LÀ-BAS, JE NE SAIS OÙ…” What is clear today, at this disastrous moment in which Cristiano & Companhia failed in their mission in Braga, and in which the self-sabotage of Russia's gas pipelines reminds us that Putin will be willing to do anything to maintain dominance over the areas endorsed, is that, bomb for bomb, the “bomb” of the Fifth Empire was preferable. However, even in this, my dears, we were irresolute, a little more on the side of piela than determined, and we procrastinated.

item.title: Suspected of sending drones to North Korea worked in former South leader's office
item.description: Two civilians suspected of being involved in recent drone deployments to North Korea worked in former President Yoon Suk-yeol's office, according to an investigation published yesterday by local news agency Yonhap. The news was released at a time when an investigation is being carried out in Seoul in response to Pyongyang's accusations about the presence of drones in North Korea, in September 2025 and at the beginning of this year. The first suspect, a man in his 30s, who apparently only worked on manufacturing the drone, was a news supervisor in the presidential spokesperson's office during the Yoon government, according to the agency. The other suspect, also in his 30s and also working at the presidential complex during the Yoon government, publicly claimed to have operated the drones, in an interview broadcast on Friday by local channel Channel A. The suspect is currently pursuing postgraduate studies in journalism at a private university in Seoul. The two suspects studied at the same university and founded a drone manufacturing company in 2024, according to Yonhap. The investigation does not specify the exact years they worked for Yoon, who began his term in May 2022 and ended in April last year, after being removed by the brief declaration of martial law in December 2024. Yoon Suk-yeol, currently in pre-trial detention, faces charges of abuse of power and other crimes related to the alleged sending of drones to North Korea to disseminate anti-Pyongyang propaganda. The Public Ministry alleges that the then president ordered the operation to provoke a reaction from the neighboring country and justify the imposition of martial law. Flights of discord North Korea accused the South at the UN, in February last year, of sending drones in October 2024 to spread propaganda over the capital Pyongyang. Yonhap's work also indicates that the first suspect was already interrogated on Friday by the investigation team of the South Korean armed forces and police. The man was reported to the authorities in November for flying an unregistered drone in the Yeoju area, about 70 kilometers southeast of Seoul, and the model of the device coincided with the one North Korea claims to have shot down in the most recent report. In an interview with a local channel, the second suspect said that, since September last year, he had carried out several flights over North Korea and that the objective was to measure the levels of radiation and contamination by heavy metals in a uranium factory near the Ryesong River, in North Korean territory. North Korea reported on January 10 that South Korean drones flew over the territory in September last year and again on January 4 this year. The government of the current South Korean President, Lee Jae-myung, denied that the drones were military aircraft and began an investigation this week, without ruling out the possibility of civilian involvement. The North Korean accusation came as a surprise, given that Lee had told the EFE news agency in December that Seoul might have to apologize to Pyongyang for alleged drone flights during Yoon's presidency.

item.title: Diplomacy | “Healthy and stable” relations serve the interests of China and Canada
item.description: The Canadian government leader's visit to China marked the return of healthy understanding between the two nations after a period of tensions and disagreements. The President of China, Xi Jinping, stated Friday that the development of “healthy and stable” relations with Canada serves the interests of both countries, during a meeting with the Canadian Prime Minister. Xi met in Beijing with Mark Carney, in what is the first visit by a Canadian head of government to the country in almost a decade and which aims to normalize bilateral relations, which have gone through periods of tension in recent years, due to diplomatic and commercial disputes. During the meeting, held at the Great Hall of the People, Xi stated that the “healthy and stable development” of relations between China and Canada “corresponds to the common interests of both countries” and contributes to “world peace, stability and prosperity”, according to Chinese state television CCTV. The Chinese leader highlighted that the previous contact between the two, in October, on the sidelines of a summit in South Korea, began a new phase of rapprochement. Xi called for the construction of “a new type of strategic partnership” capable of putting ties between Beijing and Ottawa on a “sustainable and lasting” path. Carney thanked the reception and expressed Canada's willingness to work with China “based on good past cooperation”, to develop a strategic relationship adapted to the current international context and promoting “stability, security and prosperity” for both countries and the Pacific region. The day before, the Canadian Prime Minister met with his Chinese counterpart, Li Qiang. The two discussed topics such as economic cooperation, energy and trade, and witnessed the signing of several agreements in the customs and commercial areas. Reinforced ties According to CCTV, Carney reiterated Canada's interest in strengthening cooperation in supply chains and strategic sectors, as well as its commitment to multilateralism and the international trade system. Li Qiang advocated expanding cooperation in areas such as clean energy, modern agriculture, digital technologies and the aerospace industry. Also on the sidelines of the visit, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi met with Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand, highlighting the need to eliminate interference and strengthen mutual trust to promote a “stable, solid and healthy” relationship. Carney's visit is the first by a Canadian prime minister to China since Justin Trudeau's visit in 2017, and takes place in a context of growing instability in international trade, with Ottawa seeking to diversify economic partnerships.

item.title: Thailand | New crane collapse leaves two dead and one injured
item.description: Two people died and one was injured after a crane fell onto a road on the outskirts of Thailand's capital, a day after a similar incident that killed at least 32 people. “Two people died and one was injured,” police officer Saranyapong Aonsingh told EFE news agency, adding that security officers were at the scene of the accident, where a viaduct was being built. According to reports from the Thai rescue and fire services on the social network Facebook, the crane collapsed at around 9:15 am, for reasons still unknown, at a construction site on the Rama II highway, in the province of Samut Sakhon, on the outskirts of Bangkok, hitting two cars. This accident happened one day after another crane fell on a passenger train, with 171 people on board, in northeastern Thailand, causing at least 32 deaths and more than 50 injuries. In both cases, the projects were linked to the local company Italian-Thai Development, according to Thai Transport Minister, Phiphat Ratchakitprakarn, in a television interview today. “We don’t know exactly what happened to the company (…). If the situation continues, we may have to announce a temporary stop of all its operations across the country”, he added.

item.title: Canada | Prime Minister Mark Carney visits Beijing
item.description:
After years marked by diplomatic incidents and disagreements, the Canadian Prime Minister's trip to China is seen as a new chapter in relations between the two nations
Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit to China, the first by a Canadian head of government in eight years, is seen by both countries as the beginning of a new phase in bilateral relations. According to a statement from the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, head of diplomacy Wang Yi considered Carney's visit a “turning point” with the potential to open “new perspectives” in the relationship between Beijing and Ottawa. Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand, who met with Wang yesterday, stated that Carney intends to “set the course for the development of relations” and resume dialogue in multiple areas, according to the same note. Carney, who took office 10 months ago, is trying to reestablish ties with Beijing after a period marked by disagreements, which included the detention, in 2018, of Huawei's chief financial officer, Meng Wanzhou, at the request of the US, and the imposition of mutual tariffs on strategic products such as electric vehicles, steel, aluminum, canola and seafood. The Canadian Prime Minister met yesterday with his Chinese counterpart, Li Qiang, and is expected to meet with President Xi Jinping tomorrow.
Trump Factor The mission gains urgency at a time when US President Donald Trump has increased tariffs on Canadian exports. Currently, more than 75 percent of Canada's exports are destined for the United States. Carney has set a goal of doubling Canadian exports outside the North American market over the next decade. “We are ready to build a new partnership, based on the best of our past and prepared for the challenges of the present”, wrote Carney on the X network after arriving in Beijing, on Wednesday night. The tariffs applied by Canada in 2024, under Justin Trudeau's government, followed the US example and imposed 100 percent duties on Chinese electric vehicles and 25 percent on steel and aluminum. In response, Beijing applied tariffs of 100 percent to Canadian canola oil and meal, 75.8 percent to canola seeds and 25 percent to pork and seafood products, practically closing the Chinese market to these exports, according to industry sources. China has expressed hope that the economic pressure exerted by Trump will lead US allies, such as Canada, to adopt a more autonomous foreign policy. Beijing frequently accuses Washington of forming alliances to isolate China, a common line of criticism under the Joe Biden and Trump administrations. Relations between the two countries seriously deteriorated in 2018, when Meng Wanzhou was detained in Canada at the request of the US. China retaliated with the arrest of two Canadian citizens for alleged espionage, in an episode that froze diplomatic dialogue for more than two years.

item.title: Corruption | Philippines wants ex-deputy repatriated
item.description: The Philippine President has ordered the country's government to explore all options for Elizaldy Salcedo Co to be repatriated from Portugal, where the former congressman is believed to be living, according to the Philippine press. Better known as Zaldy Co, former party deputy Ako Bicol is the subject of an arrest warrant for alleged involvement in the scandal of infrastructure “ghost projects” for flood control. Dozens of construction company owners, government officials and elected representatives across the archipelago are accused of embezzling funds or executing substandard projects. In addition to facing three criminal cases arising from the corruption scandal, Zaldy Co also made explosive allegations in a series of videos accusing Marcos Jr. and his cousin, former speaker of the Philippine House of Representatives Martin Romualdez, of receiving billions of pesos in bribes, according to the Philippine newspaper Inquirer. Interior Secretary Jonvic Remulla said on Tuesday that President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s directive orders it to be verified whether Zaldy Co can be extradited from Portugal, where he is believed to be located. "We are still studying the case because the situation is complicated. We don't have an extradition treaty [with Portugal], but there are other routes that we can follow and that he wants to investigate," Remulla said, according to the English-language Philippine newspaper. Other routes The Government, continued the official, is considering other options, including coordination with the International Criminal Police Organization (Interpol), the UN and other international agencies, he added. "An [extradition] treaty would take too long. A treaty takes years and years to conclude. Therefore, the other possible routes, as instructed by the President, are about how we can carry out his extradition without going through a treaty", he said on Tuesday. Through repatriation, the Inquirer also states, a person can be returned to their country of origin by choice or by force. In the case of extradition, “it is a legal process in which a country delivers a person accused or convicted of a crime to another country to face trial or punishment”. The newspaper also recalls that the Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) canceled Co's Philippine passport on December 10 last year, on the order of an anti-corruption court. Remulla, however, stressed that Co may also be using a Portuguese passport obtained many years ago. No news According to the DFA, the Philippine Embassy in Lisbon has not yet received information about Co's whereabouts or any confirmation from the Portuguese Government that it actually granted the former deputy a passport. Leila de Lima, a deputy from the Mamamayang Liberal party, also said on Tuesday that the Marcos government should negotiate with Portugal on the deportation of Co to the Philippines, instead of working on an extradition treaty “which requires much more effort and more time”. “Deportation can be negotiated diplomatically immediately, even without the formality of concluding an extradition treaty”, said Leila de Lima, noting that “an extradition treaty is not indispensable for the return of a fugitive to the country”. Among the suspects are allies and opponents of Marcos Jr. At stake are 9,855 drainage control projects, valued at more than 545 billion Philippine pesos (eight billion euros), which should have been built since Marcos took power, in mid-2022. In September, Philippine Finance Minister Ralph Recto admitted that, since 2023, 118.5 billion pesos (around 1.75 billion euros) may have been embezzled.

item.title: At least 25 dead after crane falls on train in Thailand
item.description: At least 25 people died yesterday when a construction crane fell onto a passenger train in northeastern Thailand, authorities said. The crane fell as the train was traveling from the capital Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, causing the derailment and a fire, according to the Public Relations Department of Nakhon Ratchasima province. The accident occurred at around 09:00, involving a crane that was being used in the construction of a high-speed elevated railway. The department said in a social media post that the fire was under control and that rescue teams were now searching for people inside the train, many of whom were trapped in overturned train cars. Rescue operations had been temporarily suspended due to a “chemical leak”, local police reported, without specifying the origin. “More than 80” people were injured, Thatchapon Chinnawong, head of a police station in Nakhon Ratchasima, northeast of Bangkok, told France-Presse news agency. Transport Minister Piphat Ratchakitprakan said there were 195 people on board the train and said he had ordered an investigation into the accident, which occurred in Ban Thanon Kho, 32 kilometers from Bangkok. Thai media outlets and internet users published numerous images of the disaster on social media, showing part of the fire and dozens of rescuers at the scene. “I heard a loud noise (…) followed by two explosions,” said Mitr Intrpanya, 54, a resident who was at the scene. "When I went to see what had happened, I found the crane resting on a three-car passenger train. The metal from the crane appeared to have split the second car in half," he added. Little supervision The crane was part of a vast high-speed train construction project in Thailand, which began in 2017, a decade late. The US$5.4 billion project aims to connect Bangkok to Kunming, in southern China, via Laos. The first section is scheduled to open in 2028 and the second in 2032. The line is supported by China as part of the One Belt, One Road initiative, launched to boost trade in the region. Industrial, construction and transport accidents are relatively frequent in Thailand due to sometimes lax enforcement of safety standards. In 2020, 18 people died in Thailand when a freight train collided with a bus carrying passengers to a religious ceremony. Eight people also died in 2023, in a collision between a freight train and a van that was crossing a railway in the east of the country.

item.title: Hong Kong | John Lee promete “ir ao fundo” de incêndio Tai Po
item.description: The leader of the former British colony reiterated his intention to punish those responsible for the tragedy that killed more than 160 people in the Tai Po social neighborhood and find appropriate solutions for those displaced. Hong Kong's Chief Executive yesterday promised to "get to the bottom" of the deadly fire in Tai Po, hold those responsible accountable and find long-term solutions to house those affected, the public broadcaster reported. According to RTHK, John Lee Ka-chiu indicated to the Legislative Council (LegCo) that post-disaster recovery work is an “urgent task”, with the Executive presenting a motion of support at the first meeting of parliament. The Government, the person responsible told deputies, “will finalize the long-term accommodation plan for the affected families as quickly as possible, so that they can settle in their new homes soon”. Lee assured that those responsible for the November 26 tragedy will be held accountable. “The police authorities and the independent committee will leave no stone unturned,” he said, promising to “get to the bottom of this issue.” “Those who must be held responsible, whether they are public servants or not and regardless of their level, will be held responsible according to the facts”, he added. The fire in the Wang Fuk Court residential complex, which is undergoing repair work, started when the net covering the bamboo structures between the ground floor and the first floor of the Wang Cheong House block caught fire. The fire spread with unusual speed to the rest of the complex, hitting six other towers and killing a total of 161 people. Yesterday, also, the Chief Executive revealed the expectations he has in relation to the LegCo deputies, elected on December 7th, shortly after the fire. “I will be happy to hear your opinions, whether you agree with the Government or not,” he said. These were the second elections since the electoral reform introduced in 2021 at the behest of Beijing, which reduced the seats elected by universal suffrage from 35 to 20, increased the weight of non-direct mechanisms and transformed the ballot into a vote in which “only patriotic (candidates)” can compete. The vote took place without the two main pro-democracy parties: the Civic Party, dissolved in 2023, and the Democratic Party, in decline. Head to LegCo Although the Executive initially considered the possibility of postponing the elections after the fire and the three days of mourning and suspension of campaign activities that followed, it ended up deciding to keep them on the scheduled date. Authorities argued that carrying out suffrage demonstrates institutional maturity and that the process can coexist with respect for victims and emergency management. In total, 161 candidates competed for 90 seats: 51 in territorial constituencies, 60 in functional constituencies and 50 designated by the Electoral Commission, dominated by profiles close to the Chinese central government. Functional constituencies represent professional groups, commercial sectors or specific special interests and only voters registered in these sectors can vote for them, which has raised criticism for the limited representation in favor of corporate interests and elites. "When you disagree with government policies, please point out the problems and make recommendations and suggestions. We will consider your suggestions seriously. When we are doing the right thing, please be fair to us," said Lee, as quoted by RTHK. The Chief Executive also indicated that legislators must speak based on facts and filter out misinformation when addressing the public.

item.title: Trade between Brazil and China grows to record value in 2025
item.description: Trade between Brazil and China grew 8.2 percent year-on-year in 2025, to a record value of 171 billion dollars, according to data released yesterday by the Brazil-China Business Council (CEBC). China remained Brazil's main trading partner, far surpassing the United States, with which bilateral trade totaled US$83 billion in the same period. According to the CEBC, Brazil's trade surplus with China was US$29.1 billion, equivalent to 43 percent of the country's entire positive balance with the world. The growth of Brazilian exports was driven mainly by the agricultural and extractive sector. The sale of crude oil to China alone reached a value of 20 billion dollars, with a record volume of 44 million tons – representing 45 percent of all oil exported by Brazil. Soy exports totaled US$34.5 billion, while beef exports grew by almost 48 percent, reaching US$8.8 billion, also a record. In contrast, sales of chicken and pork fell 53 percent and 36 percent, respectively. On the other hand On the import side, the acquisition of a platform for oil exploration worth US$2.66 billion stood out. Hybrid car purchases also increased by 25 percent, totaling $1.87 billion. On the other hand, 100 percent electric vehicles suffered a 37 percent drop in imports. China was also the main supplier of manufacturing goods to Brazil, with emphasis on fertilizers, chemical and pharmaceutical products, the latter with a 39 percent growth in purchases, driven especially by insulin-based medicines. Among Brazilian states, Rio de Janeiro led exports to China for the third consecutive year, with 18.1 billion dollars, 94 percent of which came from oil sales. With the new data, the Brazil – China trade chain represented 27.2 percent of all Brazilian foreign trade in 2025, consolidating the importance of China in the South American country's trade balance.

item.title: China | Trade surplus reaches 1 billion euros in 2025
item.description: China's trade surplus reached a new record of almost 1.2 trillion dollars in 2025, according to data released yesterday, despite the trade war with the United States. According to data released by Chinese customs authorities, exports grew 5.5 percent in 2025, totaling 3.77 billion dollars, while imports remained practically unchanged at 2.58 billion dollars. In 2024, the trade surplus had been US$992 billion. In December, exports increased 6.6 percent year-on-year, exceeding analysts' forecasts and the 5.9 percent growth recorded in November. Imports also rose 5.7 percent in December, compared to growth of 1.9 percent in the previous month. Economists predict that exports will continue to be one of the main drivers of Chinese Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in 2026, despite trade and geopolitical tensions. “We continue to expect exports to play an important role in economic growth this year,” said Jacqueline Rong, chief China economist at BNP Paribas.
